coverage.notes: Adequate coverage of the object's exterior with some focus on profile views. However, the base, interior, and detailed mark are underrepresented.

image_assessments.notes: Close-up of the base with visible mark but some glare affects readability.
Front view of the vase; details are clear.
Top view showing the rim clearly.
Left profile view, clear and sharp.

visual_evidence.notes: The glaze shows clear crazing and a gradient color effect. Construction details are less clear due to the absence of visible seams or throwing marks. Base is macro view but has glare.

key_observations: Gradient color glaze evident on the form (img_01, img_03).
Rim appears straight with a slight outward curve (img_02).
Rounded shoulder transitioning to a long, even body (img_01, img_03).
No visible seam lines or throwing rings, suggesting possible slip cast or unknown method (img_01, img_03).
limitations: Base not fully visible for foot type due to glare (img_00).

estimated_material.label: stoneware
rationale: Visible crazing suggests stoneware with a glaze fit issue (img_01).
Opacity and surface texture typical of stoneware.

indicators: No visible seams or throwing rings.

proportions_notes: The vase has a uniform, smooth body with a rounded base and medium neck, typical of modern decorative vases.

color_behavior_notes: Gradient color from base to rim with pooling of darker color near rim (img_01, img_03).

layout_notes: Bold color gradient focusing near the neck rim, minimal decoration on the body.

rationale: Crazing visible, suggesting age-related glaze issues (img_01).
